body.productDescription: Deepgram is a foundational AI company on a mission to understand human language. We give any developer access to the most advanced speech AI transcription and understanding with just an API call. Our models deliver the fastest, most accurate transcription alongside contextual features like summarization, sentiment analysis, and topic detection. Beyond that, developers can: 🔊 Process live-streaming or pre-recorded audio 🌎 Transcribe in dozens of languages ⚙️ Train custom models for unique use cases 🔑 Access deep NLU with a unified API 💻 Build in any programming language with our SDKs ✅ Deploy on-prem or on DG’s managed cloud 📈 Get scalable GPU infrastructure for training and inference Get started with $200 in free credit (up to 45,000 minutes) of free transcription and understanding.

videoReviews.reviewCaption: Think Audio to Text go for the Deepgram

reviews.reviewText: Transcription made easy for teams and individuals in our company

reviewDetails.question: What do you like best about Deepgram?
reviewDetails.answer: I love that Deepgram captures the audio and video, transcribing them with such accuracy. It’s worked great for transcribing client meetings and internal discussions. With the features to store and share transcriptions with platforms such as Google Drive, it’s easy to integrate with. If you attend live meetings or events the best part is the ability to transcribe in real time. Moreover, the AI itself gets better, so each transcription gets better and better as time progresses. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

reviewDetails.question: What do you dislike about Deepgram?
reviewDetails.answer: One thing I’ve found annoying in Deepgram is that sometimes background noise causes problems with the transcription. Essentially the system works fine, but sometimes when a long transcription job goes a little long the system will lag. I wish I could also customize more to get the outputs how I would like them. They work well, but they still miss context at times, especially with technical or domain specific words and you still need to edit them. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

reviewDetails.question: What problems is Deepgram solving and how is that benefiting you?
reviewDetails.answer: Using Deepgram, we have found it has made transcription much simpler, saving us a huge amount of time and effort. I don’t need to transcribe recordings manually anymore and I can focus on other important work. We’ve streamlined our workflow, where my team instantly have access to accurate text from meetings and calls, allowing them to collaborate more efficiently and avoid the important details falling between the cracks. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

reviews.reviewText: Transcribing audio is now so much faster

reviewDetails.question: What do you like best about Deepgram?
reviewDetails.answer: With their speech recognition Deepgram is incredibly fast and incredibly accurate, making listening to meeting and call transcriptions much easier. I also like that it integrates very smoothly with Slack and Zoom giving easy access to transcriptions right inside the app. This ability to work with many different accents and dialects is critical to our diverse team. Furthermore, the simple setup and easy to use API lends itself to customization of the software into answering precisely our workflow needs. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

reviewDetails.question: What do you dislike about Deepgram?
reviewDetails.answer: The only flaw I saw with Deepgram as it misinterprets an audio with lots of background noise. It does well on quiet environments but the transcription quality falls when there is noise interference. And it sometimes misunderstands technical parlance, which I have to correct by default. It’s not all bad though, it would simply be nice for customer support to be a little quicker because sometimes they take a while to respond to more complex questions. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

reviewDetails.question: What problems is Deepgram solving and how is that benefiting you?
reviewDetails.answer: Deepgram significantly improved our workflow through elimination and automation of meeting transcription and call transcription. We can now save a ton of time by spending it reviewing transcripts, rather than spending hours transcribing audio. It also allows us to keep on meeting documentation and follow ups and make sure that nothing is missed. Transcriptions are no longer prone to errors, the accuracy and speedy level helps us to communicate within our team and makes our productivity better. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

This has benefited our customers and enhanced the company’s productivity by many folds. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

reviews.reviewText: Great Product, and Really Great People

We can quickly try out new options with little programming. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
